comments:
Driver:  1104_2243 I-driver

When going through a bottom-up Web service in project "a" (choosing Generate 
proxy and Test Web Service), even though the Web service wizard completes 
successfully, the result.jsp does not compile even if the server is restarted.

When I tried to use the Web Services Explorer to test the Web service, I got 
the error:

java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: echo.Echo
	at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader.loadClass
(WebappClassLoader.java:1340)
	at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoader.loadClass
(WebappClassLoader.java:1189)
	at org.apache.axis.utils.ClassUtils$2.run(ClassUtils.java:186)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at org.apache.axis.utils.ClassUtils.loadClass(ClassUtils.java:160)
	at org.apache.axis.utils.ClassUtils.forName(ClassUtils.java:142)
	at org.apache.axis.utils.cache.ClassCache.lookup(ClassCache.java:85)
	at org.apache.axis.providers.java.JavaProvider.getServiceClass
(JavaProvider.java:428)
	at org.apache.axis.providers.java.JavaProvider.initServiceDesc
(JavaProvider.java:461)
	at org.apache.axis.handlers.soap.SOAPService.getInitializedServiceDesc
(SOAPService.java:285)
	at org.apache.axis.deployment.wsdd.WSDDService.makeNewInstance
(WSDDService.java:500)
	at org.apache.axis.deployment.wsdd.WSDDDeployableItem.getNewInstance
(WSDDDeployableItem.java:274)
	at org.apache.axis.deployment.wsdd.WSDDDeployableItem.getInstance
(WSDDDeployableItem.java:260)
	at 
org.apache.axis.deployment.wsdd.WSDDDeployment.getServiceByNamespaceURI
(WSDDDeployment.java:436)
	at org.apache.axis.configuration.FileProvider.getServiceByNamespaceURI
(FileProvider.java:247)
	at org.apache.axis.AxisEngine.getService(AxisEngine.java:314)
	at org.apache.axis.MessageContext.setTargetService
(MessageContext.java:755)
	at org.apache.axis.handlers.http.URLMapper.invoke(URLMapper.java:50)
	at org.apache.axis.strategies.InvocationStrategy.visit
(InvocationStrategy.java:32)
	at org.apache.axis.SimpleChain.doVisiting(SimpleChain.java:118)
	at org.apache.axis.SimpleChain.invoke(SimpleChain.java:83)
When I ping the location:

http://localhost:8080/a/services/AdminService

The Web service engine is working fine.

I tried the same workaround I did with the 1104_0542 driver to use Project 
properties to set server target.  The Web service bean class still cannot be 
found and the Web service cannot be run.

The same problem happens on top-down scenario.

Here's the steps to recreate the problem:

To recreate the problem:

1. Install Tomcat 5 server runtime.
2. Create a Dynamic Web project "a" targetting Tomcat 5.
3. Create a Java file Echo.java in project "a".  Right-click, select Create Web 
Service.  Click Finish.
4. After the Web service wizard finish.  Go to the a/WebContent/wsdl directory 
and select Echo.wsdl.  Right-click, select Web Services -> Test with the Web 
Services Explorer.

Invoke the Web service and you'll see the error:

java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: echo.Echo

This used to work in the 1104_0542 I-driver and since Web services did not drop 
any changes between these two 1104 I-driver, there's a possibility that this 
could be due to the fixes made in  114681 and 115068.  

Chuck and Konstantin, could you think of anything in the fix of these 2 defects 
that could have caused this?
I have the same problem with the 1105_19:46 I driver.

Hi no I don't - But I have reproduced this behavior just deploying a simple
servlet scenario....   I'm worried about a few of the regressions last week -
this is a major one - I'll look into further from our end

I just tried the 1105_1946 I-driver and could not run a simple servlet (like 
what Chuck had found out as well).

This is fixed for the 1107 evening or 1108 morning EST WTP committers build or
the official 1112 wtp m9 integration build.

There was a problem with the addition of web project java resources in the
deployables.

I pulled in the fix in HEAD for jst.j2ee, jst.j2ee.core and 
wst.common.modulecore, I can now run Web service scenarios. Would it be 
possible to get patched JARs on top of the 1105_1946 I-driver?
